volunteer_experience.info:
MIT COVID19 Challenge was hosted by Massachusetts Institute of Technology. It was my first experience for being part of any world level hackathon. My team was top 5 global finalist for healthcare track, we proposed an idea of developing an app which can help rural India people to easily approach a good doctor and they can also clarify whether the doctor is fake or genuine by using the features of the app and we added many more features like looking for the COVID19 hospital near by and booking aâ€¦
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          MIT COVID19 Challenge was hosted by Massachusetts Institute of Technology. It was my first experience for being part of any world level hackathon. My team was top 5 global finalist for healthcare track, we proposed an idea of developing an app which can help rural India people to easily approach a good doctor and they can also clarify whether the doctor is fake or genuine by using the features of the app and we added many more features like looking for the COVID19 hospital near by and booking a nearest ambulance just by sharing their locations. There were 5 member in my team from different countries but we all had a common interest of developing and thinking something innovative which helped us to be the global finalist for this challenge. 
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: MIT COVID-19 Challenge
volunteer_experience.title: Top 5 Finalist

publications: [{"title":"Real-Time Face Swapping System using OpenCV","subtitle":"IEEE","date":"October 1, 2021","description":"Face swapping has been a thriving genre of work which primarily is associated with the replacement or substitution of one referral face on the face of the other person, be it by means of still images or in real time. This paper exhibits the research on Real-Time Face Swapping algorithm, using the reference image of the user and henceforth considering it as our input image instead of using a data set thereby working on a real time model by the use of the python open-source model of Computer Vision i.e., OpenCV."}]

projects.title: COVID19 Detector Using X-Ray Images and CT-Scan Images
projects.description: I have developed a COVID-19 DETECTOR in X-ray images with Keras, TensorFlow, and Deep Learning which can detect a COVID-19 patient within 5 seconds.Why X-Ray images? It's because since COVID-19 attacks the epithelial cells that line our respiratory tract, we can use X-rays to analyze the health of a patientâ€™s lungs.In this detector I have used machine learning models like CNN and KNN model and after gathering my dataset, I was left with 50,000 total images, equally split with 25,000 images of COVID-19 positive X-rays and 25,000 images of healthy patient X-rays.The data is available on kaggle and after collecting the data I trained my model and after a continous effort and failing many times I succeed and was pretty shocked by the results when I got the accuracy of 100%.Till now it's the highest accuracy provider machine learning model which can easily detect Coronavirus infected person. The main advantage of this detector are : - Its a free software, Its time efficient that is it can provide the result within 5 seconds instead of 1day and for sure it can't remove the work of doctors but can make their work easy.
